subanswer.text: To calculate the number of pupils who like the color yellow, subtract the numbers of people who like blue and green from the total number of pupils. Since half the class likes blue, that accounts for 8876718 / 2 = 4438359 pupils. Then take these 4438359 and divide by 4 since one fourth likes green, resulting in 1109589.5 pupils. However, you cannot have half a person, so round down because if any leftover individuals would still imply they belong to the group that prefers red over green. That makes Green lovers approximately 1109590. Deduct these numbers from the total population size yields an approximate figure of about 334393 children who enjoy Red!
